Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Santos Lopez Sanchez

records.addlTxt: Saul Arteaga

Defendant Santos Lopez Sanchez in court.  Attorney James B. Duquette in court for Santos Lopez Sanchez.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Arteaga previously sworn by clerk. Trial dates set, joined with 22CT18. Minutes filed.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 11, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Randomly reassigned:  Case will remain assigned to Judge Koss after August 1, 2022.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
with Exhibit #1 attached

3:06 PM (64-06) Defendant Santos Lopez Sanchez in court with Spanish Interpreter Sara St. John.  Attorney James B. Duquette in court for Santos Lopez Sanchez.  Attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State called to the stand as a witness Michelle Czlapinski, City of Whitewater Police Department.
Michelle Czlapinski duly sworn and testified on direct examination by ADA Berg. Witness identified the defendant in court.
Exhibit #1 marked, identified and discussed in court.
Exhibit #1 offered and received by the court.
3:10PM - Cross examination by Attorney Duquette.
Attorney Duquette acknowledged the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client.
Speedy Trial is reserved.

Attorney Duquette is requesting 60 days for a Status Hearing.

Judge to be assigned and set for Status Hearing.
Sarah St John

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney James Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Santos Lopez Sanchez in court.  Attorney James B. Duquette in court for Santos Lopez Sanchez. Interpreter St John previously sworn. Comp eval received and defense agrees with findings. Court finds defendant competent to proceed. Preliminary hearing rights given and hearing requested. Time period waived. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Sarah St John

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Santos Lopez Sanchez in court.  Attorney Ashley Renz for James B. Duquette in court for Santos Lopez Sanchez. Interpreter St John previously sworn. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Called at 1:57 PM. Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Santos Lopez Sanchez in court.  Attorney James B. Duquette in court for Santos Lopez Sanchez. Set for WOPH but record by Attorney Duquette who must raise issue of competency. Interpreter Sarah St. John previously sworn. Court orders competency evaluation and sets all matters for STC. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Sarah St John
Disposed as WOPH in error. np

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:09 PM - Defendant Santos Lopez Sanchez in court with interpreter Laura Blancas. Attorney James Duquette in court for and with Santos Lopez-Sanchez.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin James Duquette in court. 
Attorney Duquette made a record, defendant was unsure if he wanted to continue to have Attorney Duquette represent him. Defendant would like to continue with Attorney Duquette.
Attorney Duquette requests a hearing before the Judge, confusion with the defendant's cases.
No objection by the State.

Adj. 2:13 PM
Waiver of Prelim scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

(64-06) Defendant Santos Lopez Sanchez appeared in court, Attorney Samuel Thomas Berg appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Duquette appeared in court for Santos Lopez Sanchez. Interpreter Sara St. John appeared in court.
Attorney Duquette states defendant would like to seek different counsel.
Court will allow defendant one month to hire counsel.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Arteaga

Defendant Santos Lopez Sanchez in court with attorney James Duquette. James T Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Saul Arteaga previously sworn by clerk. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Sara St John
Signed bond filed with the court.

BOND TO COVER 22GF37, 21CM398 & 21CM574

Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Not to operate a motor vehicle without an IID installed. Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S):  NO CONTACT WITH M.J.A (dob 1/10/1971).  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Santos Lopez Sanchez in court with attorney James Duquette.  Interpreter Sara St. John, previously sworn by clerk, in court for Defendant.  Andrew Herrmann for State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.
Notice of Arrest
Signed bond filed with the court.

DEFENDANT MUST POST $2,500.00 CASH
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Not to operate a motor vehicle without an IID installed.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons.  Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

22-109 thru 22-114
see signature bond for conditions
